Name: Delaying the greenhouse gas emission reduction requirements outlined in Local Law 97 by 7 years.
Title: A Local Law to amend the city charter and the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to delaying the greenhouse gas emission reduction requirements outlined in Local Law 97 by 7 years
BodyName: Committee on Environmental Protection, Resiliency and Waterfronts

History.Description: This Introduction was Introduced by Council
This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Environmental Protection, Resiliency and Waterfronts

Summary: This bill would delay by 7 years all requirements and related penalties created by Local Law 97 pertaining to the reduction of greenhouse gas emissions by buildings.
Text:
Be it enacted by the Council as follows:
      
      
      Section 1. Paragraph 3 of subdivision a of section 651 of chapter 26 of the New York city charter, as amended by local law number 97 for the year 2019, is amended to read as follows: 
      3.         (1) Reduction of emissions citywide. There shall be, at minimum, a 40 percent reduction in citywide emissions by calendar year [2030] 2037, and an 80 percent reduction in citywide emissions by calendar year [2050] 2057, relative to such emissions for the base year for citywide emissions.

      (3) Reduction of emissions by the New York city housing authority. If the office determines that such emissions reduction is not feasible despite the best efforts of city government operations, such office shall report such findings and make recommendations with respect to policies, programs and actions that may be undertaken to achieve such reductions.

For the purposes of this section, additionality means a requirement that an offset project is not already required by local, national or international regulations. Prior to the department promulgation of rules, the department shall consult the advisory board on environmental justice as established in local law 64 of 2017.

\pard\ltrpar\sa240\qj\b\'a7 28-320.8.1.1 Extension of effective period.\b0  The commissioner may also grant an extension of the effective period of the adjustment to applicable annual building emissions limit for calendar years [2030-2035] \ul 2037-2042\ulnone , as prescribed by section 28-320.3.8. Such extension may be granted upon submission of a schedule of alterations to the covered building or changes to the operations and management of the covered building in accordance with section 28-320.8 sufficient to ensure that by [2035] \ul 2042\ulnone  the covered building will comply with a required building emissions limit that is 50 percent of the reported 2018 building emissions for the covered building.\par
\pard\ltrpar\fi720\sl480\slmult1\qj\'a7 18. Section 28-320.9 of the administrative code of the city of New York, as amended by local law 126 for the year 2021, is amended to read as follows:\par
\pard\ltrpar\sa240\qj\b\'a7 28-320.9 Adjustment to applicable annual building emissions limit for not-for-profit hospitals and healthcare facilities.\b0  The department shall grant an adjustment of the annual building emissions limits for calendar years [2024-2029] \ul 2031-2036\ulnone  and [2030-34] \ul 2037-2041\ulnone  where:\par
\pard\ltrpar\li360\sa240\qj 1. The building is classified as a not-for-profit hospital, not-for-profit health center, or not-for-profit HIP center, in existence on the effective date of this article; and \par
2. By no later than July 21, 2021, the owner of the covered building submits an application to the department for such adjustment in a form and manner prescribed by the department. \par
\pard\ltrpar\li360\sb240\sa240\qj For calendar years [2024] \ul 2031\ulnone  through [2029] \ul 2036\ulnone , the adjustment shall result in the covered building being subject to an emissions limit that is 85 percent of the calendar 2018 building emissions for such covered building. For calendar years [2030] \ul 2037\ulnone  through [2034] \ul 2041\ulnone , the adjustment shall result in the covered building being subject to an emissions limit that is 70 percent of the calendar 2018 building emissions for such covered building. \par
\pard\ltrpar\fi720\sl480\slmult1\qj\'a7 19. Section 28-321.2.1 of the administrative code of the city of New York, as amended by local law 126 for the year 2021, is amended to read as follows: \par
\pard\ltrpar\sa240\qj\b\'a7 28-321.2.1 Energy compliant buildings.\b0  The owner of a covered building shall demonstrate that, for calendar year [2024] \ul 2031\ulnone , the annual building emissions of such covered building did not exceed what the applicable annual building emissions limit would be pursuant to section 28-320.3.2 if such building were a covered building as defined in article 320 of this chapter.\par
\pard\ltrpar\fi720\sl480\slmult1\qj\'a7 20. The lead title of section 28-321.2.2 of the administrative code of the city of New York, as amended by local law 126 for the year 2021, is amended to read as follows: \par
\pard\ltrpar\sa240\qj\b\'a7 28-321.2.2 Prescriptive energy conservation measures.\b0  By December 31, [2024] \ul 2031\ulnone , the owner of a covered building shall ensure that the following energy conservation measures have been implemented where applicable: \par
\pard\ltrpar\fi720\sl480\slmult1\qj\'a7 21. Item 10 of section 28-321.2.2 of the administrative code of the city of New York, as amended by local law 126 for the year 2021, is amended to read as follows: \par
\pard\ltrpar\li360\sa240\qj 10.  Upgrading lighting to comply with the standards for new systems set forth in section 805 of the New York city energy conservation code and/or applicable standards referenced in such energy code on or prior to December 31, [2024] \ul 2031\ulnone . This provision is subject to exception 1 in section 28-310.3, provided that July 1, 2010 is replaced by January 1, 2020 for the purposes of this section; \par
\pard\ltrpar\fi720\sl480\slmult1\qj\'a7 22. Section 28-321.3 of the administrative code of the city of New York, as amended by local law 126 for the year 2021, is amended to read as follows:\par
\pard\ltrpar\sa240\qj\b\'a7 28-321.3 Reports.\b0  By May 1, [2025] \ul 2032\ulnone , an owner of a covered building shall submit a report to the department to demonstrate compliance with this section in accordance with section 28-321.3.1 or section 28-321.3.2. \par
\pard\ltrpar\fi720\sl480\slmult1\qj\'a7 23. Section 28-321.3.1 of the administrative code of the city of New York, as amended by local law 126 for the year 2021, is amended to read as follows:\par
\pard\ltrpar\sa240\qj\b\'a7 28-321.3.1 Energy compliant buildings reports.\b0  The owner of a covered building shall file with the department a report, certified by a registered design professional, prepared in a form and manner and containing such information as specified in rules of the department, that for calendar year [2024] \ul 2031\ulnone  such building was in compliance with the applicable building emissions limit established pursuant to section 28-320.3.2.\par
\pard\ltrpar\fi720\sl480\slmult1\qj\'a7 24. This local law shall take effect immediately. \ul\par
